title: Tomorrow.io weather satellites pass critical design review
summary: A week after calling off a SPAC merger intended to raise $420 million for a constellation of commercial weather radar satellites, Tomorrow.io said March 16 its two pathfinder spacecraft passed their critical design review.

title: El telescopio Webb de la NASA alcanza un hito en su alineación
summary: El telescopio Webb de la NASA alcanza un hito en su alineación

title: NASA’s Webb Reaches Alignment Milestone, Optics Working Successfully
summary: Following the completion of critical mirror alignment steps, NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope team expects that Webb’s optical performance will be able to meet or exceed the science goals the observatory was built to achieve.

title: NASA’s plant-growing technology could be used to produce food at military bases
summary: Eden Grow Systems and Rhea Space Activity won a Small Business Innovation Research Phase 1 contract to look at possible applications of aeroponic technology to grow produce at  inhospitable locations where some Space Force units are deployed.

title: NASA Mourns Passing of Visionary Heliophysicist Eugene Parker
summary: Dr. Eugene N. Parker, visionary of heliophysics and namesake of NASA’s Parker Solar Probe, has passed away. He was 94.

title: SpaceX rapidly stacks Starship and Super Heavy with ‘Mechazilla’
summary: For the second time ever, SpaceX has used Starbase’s ‘Mechazilla’ tower and arms to stack a Starship upper stage on top of...

title: Spire to build space situational awareness satellites for NorthStar
summary: NorthStar Earth & Space, a company planning a satellite constellation to collect space situational awareness (SSA) data, is working with Spire to field an initial fleet of spacecraft.

title: Astronauts prep for new solar arrays on nearly seven-hour spacewalk
summary: Astronauts Kayla Barron and Raja Chari floated out of the International Space Station airlock for a spacewalk Tuesday, installing brackets and struts to support new solar arrays to upgrade the research lab’s power system on the same day that crewmate Mark Vande Hei marked his 341st day in orbit, a U.S. record for a single spaceflight.

title: NASA Extends Ingenuity Helicopter Mission
summary: With its recent 21st flight complete, the Red Planet rotorcraft is on its way to setting more records during its second year of operations.

title: DoD estimates $2.5 billion price tag for global constellation to track hypersonic missiles
summary: A $550 million congressional add-on in 2022 would only be a down payment to kickstart the deployment of a 28-satellite constellation of infrared space sensors in low Earth orbit
